Ini Langkah Kemenhub Usut Monopoli Tol Laut
03 Nov 2019, 12:12 by Alfi Kholisdinuka


Foto: Pool/Kemenhub

Jakarta - Menyusul pernyataan Presiden Joko Widodo beberapa waktu yang lalu terkait dugaan adanya monopoli di penyelenggaraan tol laut di pelabuhan tanjung perak, Kementerian Perhubungan bersama dengan seluruh stakeholder dan shipper atau consignee melaksanakan evaluasi kuota muatan dan pengawasan disparitas harga barang."Kita mengidentifikasi pola potensi monopoli terjadi itu di titik mana, hasil identifikasi kami dugaan praktik monopoli tersebut terjadi di daerah timur, seperti Maluku dan Papua," ujar Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Capt. Wisnu Handoko dalam keterangan tertulis, Minggu (3/11/2019)"Karena itu, kami menindaklanjuti sesuai arahan Presiden melalui Menteri Perhubungan agar kita lebih menyoroti Maluku dan Papua, di mana Papua kita akan masuk lebih mendalam," imbuh Capt Wisnu saat memimpin Rapat Evaluasi Kuota Muatan dan Disparitas Harga Barang di Kantor PT Pelni Surabaya.Dia mengatakan rapat evaluasi ini bertujuan untuk mencari suatu keseimbangan sehingga iklim dari ekosistem tol laut ini bisa sehat ke depannya. Pada kesempatan yang sama, perwakilan dari Kementerian Perdagangan, Hamida, yang juga turut hadir dalam rapat tersebut mencoba menggarisbawahi bahwa salah satu tugas dari Kemendag adalah memonitor kuota muatan. Ia menilai bahwa setiap daerah minimal harus ada tiga pelaku usaha yang melakukan pengiriman barang. "Kalau ada 1 atau 2 itu diduga akan ada monopoli, tetapi jika sudah mendekati closing time maka ketika tidak ada mengajukan permintaan booking lagi maka kita akan tetap memberikan kepada yang order," kata Hamida. Ia menyimpulkan dari pengamatannya, tol laut ini baru mampu menurunkan harga sekitar 10-20% dari harga normal hanya beberapa saat ketika kapal datang. "Makanya itu kita pengennya kontinuitas dari kapal ini harus ditingkatkan, jangan hanya tiga minggu atau dua minggu sekali kalau bisa setiap minggu datang kesitu," terangnya.Ia menilai selama ini tol laut berhasil menjaga kestabilan harga. "Harga itu tidak sampai melonjak di hari-hari HBKN (Hari Besar Keagamaan Nasional) atau terjadi cuaca buruk, jadi dia tidak sampai terjadi lonjakan harga tetap stabil," jelasnya. Selain itu, lebih lanju bahwa kewajiban consignee itu memiliki fakta integritas yang didalamnya dicantumkan bahwa kewajibannya menurunkan harga barang di bawah harga pasar. "Ketika teman-teman di Dinas Perdagangan memantau atau memonitoring harga itu salah satu tindakan pencegahan, ketika ditemukan mereka tetap menjual dengan harga tinggi dilakukan pembatalan pakta integritas yang artinya dicabut tidak bisa menggunakan angkutan tol laut lagi," tegasnya. Sedangkan Kepala Seksi Transportasi Laut Kementerian Desa, Pembangunan Daerah Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi Farida Sijabat memberikan pandangannya terhadap permasalahan ini."Harapan dari kami keterlibatan dari Pemda perlu sekali karena kewenangan lokasi ini kan Pemda yang sangat tau terjadi itu pemda, tolong dilibatkan juga Pemda, Bupati, Dinas Perdagangan Daerah," tuturnya."Kami mohon kita bersama-sama kembali mengingat bahwa ini adalah subsidi, bukan kepentingan pihak lain. Kembali lagi bahwa ini barang subsidi, tolong pergunakan dengan sebaik-baiknya dan tujuannya hanya satu untuk masyarakat miskin," tambahnya.Pada kesempatan yang sama, perwakilan Komisi Pengawasan Persaingan Usaha (KPPU) Jawa Timur, Dendy, mengatakan bahwa sesuai amanah Undang-Undang Nomor 5 Tahun 1999 tentang Larangan Praktek Monopoli Dan Persaingan Usaha Tidak Sehat definisi monopoli yaitu yang berbahaya dan wajib diawasi KPPU adalah praktik monopoli dan persaingan usaha yang tidak sehat. "Artinya sebenarnya Undang-Undang di maksud justru mendorong pelaku usaha itu silahkan ekspansi semakin besar dan yang kecil dikasih kesempatan dengan kesempatan berusaha yang sama. Masalahnya adalah ketika sudah berada pada posisi dominan kita mulai cari-cari cara yang tidak benar, seperti menghambat pesaingnya, dekati birokrasinya, ada pemain baru dihambat, kapalnya dilamain, ini yang bahaya," jelasnya.Selain itu, dirinya juga setuju ke depan akan dilakukan perbaikan terkait integrasi logistik, help desk serta monitoring dan evaluasi. "Saya yakin di setiap daerah pasti ada permasalahan yang mungkin tidak sama, saya minta ditangani secara arif," ujarnya.Perwakilan dari KPPU Makassar, Hilman, yang hadir juga mengatakan lokasi dan tujuan dari tol laut ini banyak di sekitarnya. "Jadi kami siap untuk kolaborasi untuk proses pengawasan sambil kita lihat apakah ada indikasi-indikasi yang tadi disebutkan, tidak hanya praktik monopoli tetapi apakah ada persaingan usaha tidak sehat juga di dalam proses logistik ini," pungkasnya. This is the Step of the Ministry of Transportation to Investigate the Sea Toll Monopoly
03 Nov 2019, 12:12 by Alfi Kholisdinuka


Photo: Pool / Ministry of Transportation

Jakarta - Following the statement of President Joko Widodo some time ago related to the alleged monopoly in the operation of the sea toll at Tanjung Perak Harbor, the Ministry of Transportation together with all stakeholders and shipper or consignee conducted an evaluation of the cargo quota and monitoring of price disparities in goods. "We identified potential patterns of monopoly "At that point, the results of our identification of alleged monopolistic practices occurred in the eastern regions, such as Maluku and Papua," said Capt. Director of Traffic and Sea Transportation. Wisnu Handoko in a written statement, Sunday (11/03/2019) "Therefore, we follow up according to the President's direction through the Minister of Transportation so that we will be more focused on Maluku and Papua, where our Papua will enter more deeply," Capt Wisnu added when chairing the Meeting Cargo Quota Evaluation and Goods Price Disparity at PT Pelni Surabaya Office. He said the evaluation meeting aimed to find a balance so that the climate of the marine toll ecosystem could be healthy in the future. On the same occasion, representatives from the Ministry of Trade, Hamida, who was also present at the meeting tried to underline that one of the tasks of the Ministry of Trade was to monitor cargo quotas. He considered that in every region there must be at least three business operators delivering goods. "If there is 1 or 2 it is suspected that there will be a monopoly, but if it is approaching closing time then when there is no request to book again then we will still give to the order," Hamida said. He concluded from his observation that this sea toll could only reduce the price by around 10-20% from the normal price just a few moments when the ship arrived. "Therefore, we want the continuity of this ship to be increased, not only once every three weeks or two weeks if possible, to come there every week," he explained. He believes that so far the sea toll has managed to maintain price stability. "The price did not go up in the days of HBKN (National Religious Holidays) or bad weather occurred, so he did not see a price spike remain stable," he explained. In addition, it is even more advanced that the consignee's obligations have the fact of integrity which includes the obligation to reduce the price of goods below the market price. "When friends at the Trade Service monitor or monitor prices, it is one of the precautionary measures, when they are found to continue to sell at high prices, a integrity pact is canceled, meaning that it is revoked that they cannot use sea highway transportation anymore," he said. While the Head of Sea Transportation Section of the Ministry of Villages, Disadvantaged Regions and Transmigration Farida Sijabat gave their views on this issue. "Our hope is that the involvement of the Regional Government is very important because the authority of this location is the Regional Government that is very knowledgeable about the Regional Government, please also involve the Regional Government, Regent, The Regional Trade Office, "he said." We ask that we be together again to remember that this is a subsidy, not the interests of other parties. Returning again that this is a subsidized item, please use it well and only have one goal for the poor, "he added. On the same occasion, representatives of the East Java Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU), Dendy, said that according to the mandate of Law Number 5 of 1999 concerning Prohibition of Monopolistic Practices and Unfair Business Competition the definition of monopoly that is dangerous and must be monitored by KPPU is monopolistic practice and unfair business competition. "This means that the Act actually intended to encourage business actors, please expand it even greater and smaller opportunities are given the same opportunity to try. The problem is when we are in a dominant position we start looking for ways that are not right, such as inhibiting competitors, approach the bureaucracy, there are new players being hindered, ships are being hammered, this is dangerous, "he explained. In addition, he also agreed that in the future improvements would be made related to logistical integration, help desk and monitoring and evaluation. "I am sure that in every region there must be problems that may not be the same, I ask to be handled wisely," he said. Representatives from the Makassar KPPU, Hilman, who were present also said that the location and destination of this sea highway were around him. "So we are ready for collaboration for the supervision process while we see whether there are indications mentioned earlier, not only monopolistic practices but whether there is unfair business competition in this logistical process," he concluded.
